abstract: Editorial offers qualified praise for Walmart's decision to stop selling AR-15 semiautomatic assault rifle and full range of similar assault weapons; contends that, despite Walmart's decision, it is a certainty that gun manufacturing industry and National Rifle Assn will continue to support marketing of civilian firearms that are essentially variations of potent battlefield weapons.
lead_paragraph: The sale of “modern sporting rifles” is a thinly disguised campaign to put even more military-style weapons in civilian hands.

headline.main: Walmart Decides to Drop Sale of AR-15 Assault Rifles
headline.print_headline: Less Firepower in Walmart’s Gun Aisle

snippet: The sale of “modern sporting rifles” is a thinly disguised campaign to put even more military-style weapons in civilian hands.
